definition: to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to row/to paddle/profitable/worth (the effort)/it pays (to do sth)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character
dagger-axe/abbr. for 戈瑞[ge1 rui4]/(Tw) abbr. for 戈雷[ge1 lei2]
"knife" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 18)/see also 立刀旁[li4 dao1 pang2]/see also 側刀旁|侧刀旁[ce4 dao1 pang2]
plan/project/program/to plan/to map out/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]
to plot/to scheme/to bring about/to engineer/planning/producer/planner
to calculate/to weigh (pros and cons)/to view as profitable/worthwhile/value for money/cost-effective
to assign/to allocate/to transfer (money to an account)

sentences.english: Do you think matches striking causes pineapple to fall.
sentences.chinese: 你们认为划火柴导致菠萝掉下？

sentences.english: It is known as the Dragon Boat Festival because it involves dragon boat races;
sentences.chinese: 它因“龙舟节”出名，因为人们要在那天划龙舟。

sentences.english: Someone had circled the next paragraph in red.
sentences.chinese: 有人将下一段划了一个红圈。

sentences.english: This will be announced to the world tomorrow, putting an end to the whole saga .
sentences.chinese: 明天整个世界将明朗，这段传奇故事划上句号。

sentences.english: You'd better mark a white line there beforehand.
sentences.chinese: 你最好事先在那里划一条白线。

sentences.english: This means you are permanently taking time away from your home life and putting it into your work life.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着你总是要把时间从生活划到工作中去。

sentences.english: One part of the Serpentine is kept for swimmers.
sentences.chinese: 蜿蜒河的一段划为游泳区。

sentences.english: Row row row your boat, gently down the stream.
sentences.chinese: 划划划你的船，缓缓地流向小溪。

sentences.english: What's artificial is the line drawn between them.
sentences.chinese: 人为的只是在它们之间划的那条线。

sentences.english: I slide my hand along the wall and flick on a switch.
sentences.chinese: 我就用手在墙上轻抚着，划到开关处，开了灯。

sentences.english: Even gondoliers tend to hang up their paddles early.
sentences.chinese: 即便是那些划平底船的船夫也早早就准备着收桨了。

sentences.english: Rowing on the lake all day long, we were rowed out.
sentences.chinese: 我们在湖上划了一整天的船，划得精疲力尽。

sentences.english: Do not strike matches or lighters, try to avoid coughing whilst your opponent is at the table.
sentences.chinese: 当你的对手在台面击球时，不能划火柴或点燃打火机。

sentences.english: I had a gash like a long slug, just behind my ear.
sentences.chinese: 我的耳朵后面划了个口子，血流出了长长一溜。

sentences.english: This strategic plan is like a thousand knives of the enemy, so that they bleed to death.
sentences.chinese: 这一战略就像对敌人划一千刀，让他们流血至死。

sentences.english: They just make several big circles and the tables end up looking worse than when they started.
sentences.chinese: 她们就用擦布划了几个大圈，桌子比没擦时还脏。

definition: hole/opening/cut/gap/gash/my husband or wife/classifier for people (used for indicating the number of people in a family etc)/precedent
(of a meteor etc) to streak across (the sky)/(of a searchlight, lightning etc) to play across (the sky)
to cut open/to rip/to streak across (lightning, meteor etc)/to pierce (scream, searchlight etc)
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch
to attract/to arouse/to tick/to strike out/to delineate/to collude/variant of 鉤|钩[gou1], hook
to gesture/to gesticulate/to practice the moves of a martial art by imitating the teacher/to fight/to come to blows
